actions.in_committee: House Committee on Energy and Commerce
actions.text: Clean Bill H.R.4277 Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee in Lieu.

committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Fossil and Synthetic Fuels

official_title: A bill to prohibit increases in the wellhead prices of natural gas during the six-month period beginning January 1, 1983.
short_title: Natural Gas Price Control Act of 1983

summary.text: Natural Gas Price Control Act of 1983 - Provides that the maximum lawful price applicable to the first sale (a sale by a natural gas producer to a pipeline or other distributor) delivery of any natural gas produced in the United States shall be the December 31, 1982, price applicable to such natural gas. Provides that, notwithstanding the terms of the Natural Gas Policy Act of 1978 or any contract, any price increase subject to this Act shall not be effective following the expiration of the control period. Defines control period as the period beginning January 1, 1983, and ending June 30, 1983. Directs the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission to prescribe regulations which assure that the reductions in the costs which (but for this Act) would be borne by natural gas purchasers shall be passed through to such purchasers.

titles.title: Natural Gas Price Control Act of 1983
A bill to prohibit increases in the wellhead prices of natural gas during the six-month period beginning January 1, 1983.
